verbs.description: decouple (third-person singular simple present decouples, present participle decoupling, simple past and past participle decoupled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To unlink; to take or come apart.
examples: to decouple a spent rocket stage

entries.meaning: (transitive, military) To muffle the seismic waves of (a nuclear explosion) by performing it underground.
examples: Smaller explosions and decoupled tests would be permitted. Further, the United States proposed that the three powers should start intensive research on the improvement of methods for detection and identification of underground explosions  […]
